channel.title: attack.persistence on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.persistence on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Webshell Recon Detection Via CommandLine & Processes
item.description: Looking for processes spawned by web server components that indicate reconnaissance by popular public domain webshells for whether perl, python or wget are installed.

item.title: Setuid and Setgid
item.description: Detects suspicious change of file privileges with chown and chmod commands

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Search Order Hijacking
item.description: Detects potential COM object hijacking leveraging the COM Search Order

item.title: PowerShell Create Local User
item.description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell

item.title: Suspicious desktop.ini Action
item.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder’s content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.

item.title: Malicious Service Installations
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that only appear in cases of lateral movement, credential dumping and other suspicious activity

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.title: Ryuk Ransomware
item.description: Detects Ryuk ransomware activity

item.title: Cisco Local Accounts
item.description: Find local accounts being created or modified as well as remote authentication configurations

item.title: Cisco Modify Configuration
item.description: Modifications to a config that will serve an adversary’s impacts or persistence

item.title: Autorun Keys Modification
item.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry

item.title: Direct Autorun Keys Modification
item.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

item.title: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
item.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts simliar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.

item.title: Change Default File Association
item.description: When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

item.title: Svchost DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: IKEEXT and SessionEnv service, as they call LoadLibrary on files that do not exist within C:\Windows\System32\ by default. An attacker can place their malicious logic within the PROCESS_ATTACH block of their library and restart the aforementioned services “svchost.exe -k netsvcs” to gain code execution on a remote machine.

item.title: Net.exe User Account Creation
item.description: Identifies creation of local users via the net.exe command

item.title: Suspicious Bitsadmin Job via PowerShell
item.description: Detect download by BITS jobs via PowerShell

item.title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
item.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Key Linking
item.description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey

item.title: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence
item.description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator’s Feedback-Hub

item.title: Suspicious Netsh DLL Persistence
item.description: Detects persitence via netsh helper

item.title: Suspicious Service Path Modification
item.description: Detects service path modification to powershell/cmd

item.title: Powershell Profile.ps1 Modification
item.description: Detects a change in profile.ps1 of the Powershell profile

item.title: Winlogon Helper DLL
item.description: Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete. Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.

item.title: Systemd Service Reload or Start
item.description: Detects a reload or a start of a service

item.title: Webshell Remote Command Execution
item.description: Detects posible command execution by web application/web shell

item.title: DLL Load via LSASS
item.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

item.title: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent
item.description: Detects a WMi backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMi event filters

item.title: Control Panel Items
item.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

item.title: Edit of .bash_profile and .bashrc
item.description: Detects change of user environment. Adversaries can insert code into these files to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell.

item.title: Local User Creation
item.description: Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn’t happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

item.title: Execution in Webserver Root Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in a web service root folder (filter out false positives)

item.title: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
item.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

item.title: Possible Shim Database Persistence via sdbinst.exe
item.description: Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe. A shim can be used to load malicious DLLs into applications.

item.title: Scheduled Task Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session

item.title: Shells Spawned by Web Servers
item.description: Web servers that spawn shell processes could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or an other attack

item.title: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords
item.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI script event consumers

item.title: WMI Event Subscription
item.description: Detects creation of WMI event subscription persistence method

item.title: Turla PNG Dropper Service
item.description: This method detects malicious services mentioned in Turla PNG dropper report by NCC Group in November 2018

item.title: Oracle WebLogic Exploit
item.description: Detects access to a webshell dropped into a keystore folder on the WebLogic server

item.title: Registry Persistence via Explorer Run Key
item.description: Detects a possible persistence mechanism using RUN key for Windows Explorer and pointing to a suspicious folder

item.title: Default PowerSploit and Empire Schtasks Persistence
item.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

item.title: Registry Persistence Mechanisms
item.description: Detects persistence registry keys

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage
item.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen

item.title: Defrag Deactivation
item.description: Detects the deactivation of the Scheduled defragmentation task as seen by Slingshot APT group

item.title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder

item.title: WMI Persistence
item.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on event id 5861 and 5859 (Windows 10, 2012 and higher)

item.title: Turla Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of malicious services mentioned in Carbon Paper - Turla report by ESET

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Suspicious Driver Load from Temp
item.description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory

item.title: Webshell Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects webshells that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
item.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: Antivirus Web Shell Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a web shell

item.title: Bitsadmin Download
item.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

item.title: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
item.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs - https://twitter.com/jhencinski/status/1102695118455349248 - https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/Investigating+Microsoft+BITS+Activity/23281/

item.title: Creation Of An User Account
item.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

item.title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
item.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

item.title: Fax Service DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: The Fax service attempts to load ualapi.dll, which is non-existent. An attacker can then (side)load their own malicious DLL using this service.

item.title: FlowCloud Malware
item.description: Detects FlowCloud malware from threat group TA410.

item.title: Leviathan Registry Key Activity
item.description: Detects registry key used by Leviathan APT in Malaysian focused campaign

item.title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript) Registry
item.description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method

item.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Persistence
item.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate a persistence techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE.

item.title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
item.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

item.title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications
item.description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

item.title: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
item.description: backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer

item.title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe - Zeek
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: StoneDrill Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky

item.title: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
item.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious RUN Key from Download
item.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories

item.title: Webshell ReGeorg Detection Via Web Logs
item.description: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.

item.title: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI command line event consumers

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer File Write
item.description: Detects file writes of WMI script event consumer
